head.title: The Lost Joys of Family Time

hedline.hl1: The Lost Joys of Family Time

abstract.p: Michael B Snyder letter responds to June 13 news article on parents trying to reclaim their children's time; asserts parents should teach children to make healthy lifestyle choices, not to fulfill parents' own ego-driven agendas; drawing

block.p: Re ''Parents Try to Reclaim Their Children's Time'' (news article, June 13): I find it interesting that in this day and age of school shootings, many parents put so little importance on family time. The problem faced by the parents of Wayzata, Minn., is same as the one faced by parents in the San Francisco Bay area, as parents put more pressure on themselves for their children to achieve.

Re ''Parents Try to Reclaim Their Children's Time'' (news article, June 13): I find it interesting that in this day and age of school shootings, many parents put so little importance on family time. The problem faced by the parents of Wayzata, Minn., is same as the one faced by parents in the San Francisco Bay area, as parents put more pressure on themselves for their children to achieve.

Your article noted a shocking comment -- that parents have said '' 'If I get this time with my family, you have to show me what to do with my kids.' '' Why do we feel that our children must be entertained every second and that we are the ones responsible for the entertainment? As in most relationships, there can be a lot of satisfaction in just being together.
